Configuration.Name: relayhost
Configuration.Description: The next-hop destination of non-local mail

Configuration.Name: sasl_username
Configuration.Description: username for sasl authentication

Configuration.Name: sasl_password
Configuration.Description: password for sasl authentication, if the mail relay server needs an md5 encrypted password pass the encrypted password in here otherwise plain

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_security_level
Configuration.Description: The default SMTP TLS security level for the Postfix SMTP client

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_cert_file
Configuration.Description: Postfix SMTP client RSA certificate in PEM format

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_key_file
Configuration.Description: Postfix SMTP client RSA private key in PEM format

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_CAfile
Configuration.Description: CA certificates of root CAs trusted to sign either remote SMTP server certificates or intermediate CA certificates

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_loglevel
Configuration.Description: Enable additional Postfix SMTP client logging of TLS activity

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_exclude_ciphers
Configuration.Description: List of ciphers or cipher types to exclude from the Postfix SMTP client cipher list at all TLS security levels

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_mandatory_ciphers
Configuration.Description: The minimum TLS cipher grade that the Postfix SMTP client will use with mandatory TLS encryption

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_mandatory_protocols
Configuration.Description: List of SSL/TLS protocols that the Postfix SMTP client will use with mandatory TLS encryption

Configuration.Name: smtpd_forbid_bare_newline
Configuration.Description: Disables support for malformed line endings in SMTP. This fixes CVE-2023-51764 but could break (rare) clients that mis-implement SMTP.

Configuration.Name: smtpd_forbid_bare_newline_exclusions
Configuration.Description: List of clients for which bare newlines should still be allowed. See https://www.postfix.org/postconf.5.html#smtpd_forbid_bare_newline_exclusions

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU. This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU. This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal ephemeral storage requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.
